title: Show revision completion status and progress in Subtopic Schedule view

requirements.text: Update the Subtopic revision schedule dialog (`frontend/src/components/SubTopicScheduleView.tsx`) to display a progress indicator showing how many revisions have been completed out of the total planned revisions for that subtopic (e.g., "4/5" and/or "1/5 remaining"). Use English for any user-facing text.

quotes: suppose I have to revise it 5 times totally give number by side that how many times I have revise like 4/5 or remaining 1/5 like that

acceptanceCriteria: When a user opens a subtopic schedule dialog, the UI shows a progress indicator for revisions completed out of total planned revisions (e.g., "Progress: 4/5" or "1/5 remaining").

Total planned revisions are computed consistently with the existing planned revision dates returned by `useGetPlannedRevisionDates` (i.e., the denominator matches the number of planned revision sessions shown, excluding the initial "Study Date").
The completed count uses the existing subtopic data (e.g., `subTopic.currentIntervalIndex`) and is capped to the total planned revisions so the UI never displays values like "6/5".

requirements.text: In the Subtopic revision schedule list (`frontend/src/components/SubTopicScheduleView.tsx`), visually indicate each scheduled sessionâ€™s completion status: show completed sessions in green (completed on the scheduled date or later), and show past sessions that are not completed in red; keep upcoming sessions in a neutral style. Use English for any status labels/badges.

quotes: if I complete the revision according to schedule or later show in green if not in read

acceptanceCriteria: For a subtopic with some completed revisions, the earliest N revision sessions (where N is the completed revision count) are styled as completed (green).
For any revision session with a date before today that is not yet completed, the session is styled as not completed/overdue (red).
Sessions on today or in the future that are not completed are not red; they remain neutral (or use existing today/upcoming styling) and do not appear as completed.
All new/updated user-visible labels (e.g., "Completed", "Overdue", "Progress") are in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not modify any frontend files listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only introduce migrations if state schema changes (not expected for this request).
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication methods (Internet Identity remains the only auth).
Do not introduce new backend services or external databases.
Do not change the calendar logic or today-dashboard due/overdue definitions as part of this request (only the subtopic schedule dialog presentation).
